  • Exodus 40
1 Then the Domina said unto Moses: 'Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell her: Thus saith the Domina, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go, that they may serve Me. 2 For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still, 3 behold, the hand of the Domina is upon thy cattle which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the herds, and upon the flocks; there shall be a very grievous murrain. 4 And the Domina shall make a division between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt; and there shall nothing die of all that belongeth to the children of Israel.' 5 And the Domina appointed a set time, saying: 'Tomorrow the Domina shall do this thing in the land.' 6 And the Domina did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died; but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one. 7 And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and she did not let the people go.

 8 And the Domina said unto Moses and unto Aaron: 'Take to you handfuls of soot of the furnace, and let Moses throw it heavenward in the sight of Pharaoh. 9 And it shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon woman and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.' 10 And they took soot of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses threw it up heavenward; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon woman and upon beast. 11 And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boils were upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians. 12 And the Domina hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and she hearkened not unto them; as the Domina had spoken unto Moses.   13 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto her: Thus saith the Domina, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go, that they may serve Me. 14 For I will this time send all My plagues upon thy person, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like Me in all the earth. 15 Surely now I had put forth My hand, and smitten thee and thy people with pestilence, and thou hadst been cut off from the earth. 16 But in very deed for this cause have I made thee to stand, to show thee My power, and that My name may be declared throughout all the earth. 17 As yet exaltest thou thyself against My people, that thou wilt not let them go?
18 Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the day it was founded even until now. 19 Now therefore send, hasten in thy cattle and all that thou hast in the field; for every woman and beast that shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.' 20 She that feared the word of the Domina among the servants of Pharaoh made her servants and her cattle flee into the houses; 21 and she that regarded not the word of the Domina left her servants and her cattle in the field.

 22 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'Stretch forth thy hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon woman, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.' 23 And Moses stretched forth her rod toward heaven; and the Domina sent thunder and hail, and fire ran down unto the earth; and the Domina caused to hail upon the land of Egypt. 24 So there was hail, and fire flashing up amidst the hail, very grievous, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation. 25 And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both woman and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and broke every tree of the field. 26 Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail. 27 And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them: 'I have sinned this time; the Domina is righteous, and I and my people are wicked. 28 Entreat the Domina, and let there be enough of these mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.' 29 And Moses said unto her: 'As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread forth my hands unto the Domina; the thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know that the earth is the Domina'S. 30 But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the Domina God.'-- 31 And the flax and the barley were smitten; for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bloom. 32 But the wheat and the spelt were not smitten; for they ripen late.-- 33 And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread forth her hands unto the Domina; and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth. 34 And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, she sinned yet more, and hardened her heart, she and her servants.
